Definitivamente, un juego que supero con creces mis expactativas, tanto los graficos como la jugabilidad, la combinacion de habilidades entre personajes, la adrenalina y el terror que infunden sus partidas es algo que se agradece y muy ausente en estos tiempos, quizas y digo quizas, sea uno de los pocos survival horror que sobrevivieron con un buen reload actual. una compra asegurada en la biblioteca de steam, los chicos de behaviour se aseguran que dia a dia tengas la dosis de emocion que necesitan nuestra aburridas vidas
Un bocado para el Ente...

Nie polecam ze względu na błędy z serwerami, robię se misje, jest już zrobiona tylko muszę skończyć meczyk, a tu nagle mnie ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ z meczu i nie dość, że nie dostaje bloodpointsów za mecz, nie dostaję też progresu do questa, a jedyne co dostaję to ban na 5 minut za opuszczenie rozgrywki. Nie jest to już pierwsza taka sytuacja, przy intensywnych rozgrywkach dzieje mi się tak średnio raz na tydzień, dwa. Co ciekawe sytuacja występuje jedynie gdy gram killerem, podczas gry survem jeszcze nie zdarzyło mi się, żeby mnie wywaliło. I nie, nie jest to problem z moim internetem, gdyż mam go na kablu ze światłowodu i od razu jak mnie wywala, to alt tabuję i wszystko inne mi chodzi, po minucie gierka się znowu odpala, ale co mi z tego jak straciłem możliwość dokończenia jedynego w swoim rodzaju meczu, który trwał już jakieś 20 minut. Z innych negatywnych aspektów można wymienić także fakt długiego procesu levelowania postaci (jeśli chcesz tworzyć jakieś sensowne kombinacje perków, to przydałoby się mieć już trochę godzin). Survem praktycznie nie da się grać samemu, chyba że jesteś bardzo dobry albo akurat trafią Ci się sensowni ludzie lub killer nie ogarnia, ale przeważnie twoi kompani będą przeszkadzać Ci w twoim planie na rozgrywkę. Killer często może też kampić i tunelować, bo 4 graczy, jeśli są ogarnięci i grają zespołowo ma pewną przewagę nad killerem, dlatego najłatwiejszym sposobem na "zwycięstwo" jest wyeliminowanie już na początku rozgrywki jednego z survów, a często nawet i dwóch, żeby nie pozostawić im żadnych realnych szans. Eventy polegają jedynie na kolejnej dawce challengów, za których wykonanie możesz zdobyć jeden skin dla surva i killera lub po prostu na wpisaniu odpowiedniego kodu, z którego dostaniesz breloczek do postaci lub haka. System dobierania meczu też nie jest najlepszy, killera dopasowuje do podobnej liczby mmr grupy survów, możesz być początkujący w grze i nie znać jeszcze wszystkich sztuczek, ale trafiać na zaawansowanych killerów lub survów, tylko dlatego że średnia survów jest podobna do killera, mimo że umiejętności graczy często odbiegają od siebie. Killerzy są mocno niezbalansowani, jednak taka jest idea, żeby każdy się czymś wyróżniał, większością gra się podobnie, to nawet na plus. Ale co z tego wszystkiego jak i tak dalej będziesz w to grał, bo nie ma innej takiej podobnej gry z taką bazą graczy.

The game is a 4v1 asymmetrical survivor horror game that has come a long way. There are many issues to the game along with many bright sides. This game is of course more fun to play with friends because solo queue may be a daunting task at times. I have been a player since the release of game on Xbox 1 and now I reside here. Game has interesting cosmetics, killers, survivors, and perks to use in game. If you are just first stepping into this game, watch youtubers like Otzdarva to start. He's gone in depth multiple times with killers, survivors, perks, maps, items, ect. I would Recommend this game.

I got into this game a month ago during the free weekend and really enjoyed myself: I didn't see any rude people in lobbies or salty killers facecamping people on hook. Unfortunately, that is no longer the case: each match as killer, I get toxic, salty survivors who ruin the gameplay experience for me and make me sit through an entire 30 minutes while they forcefully extend the game's duration. Killers tunnel and facecamp, and BHVR has indicated no action towards addressing the toxicity in the community. I really enjoyed the gameplay, but it became way too survivor-focused and had sore losers and ungraceful winners.
I am so addicted to this game!! Survivors can sometimes be toxic when you play killer but if you don't let it get to you it's a really fun game!

After about 50 hours of game play, I cannot recommend this game.  TL:DR – Good Game.  Bad Community.  Get the game if you are playing private matches with 5 friends.  Otherwise, save your time and money.

LET ME BE CLEAR:  The game itself is a solid:  The gameplay is as tense as it is engaging. If you're a survivor, you're constantly looking over your shoulder.  If you're the killer, you are stressed out about generators and chasing down survivors.  When a chase begins, **chef kiss** it is pure perfection.  The sounds, the music, the visuals; the craftsmanship here is on full display.  The game has a lot of potential to be very fun.  But like all multiplayer-only games, the community decides if you will enjoy this game.  And the community has decided that you don't deserve a good time.

The toxicity of the community is unparalleled these days; and that's coming from someone that came up in arcades playing Mortal Kombat and Street Fighter.  If anyone remembers how bad Halo was, or how caustic people were in DOTA, then this community will seem very familiar.  Tea-bagging, condescension, gatekeeping, and elitism saturate every match you play.  My first match as killer I was being taunted with flashlights and tea-bagged after pallet drops.  In the post-game chat, I said GG and said it was my first time as killer; hoping to get some advice or at least a “Keep at it, we all sucked our first time.”  I was, instead, smothered under an avalanche of comments about how I suck, should uninstall the game, then kill myself.  I tried to power thru.  I played a few more matches and got, I think, a lot better as killer.  But the final straw came when my friend sent me the Youtube video of that first match.  He came across this video while browsing Dead by Daylight strategies:  It was a premade group of 4 friends on voice comms and at least one of them was Twitch streaming.  Dead by Daylight does not have in game voice communication.  This was on purpose.  So, using 3rd party comms will give you an advantage over the killer.  This may work for facing higher level Killers.  But when facing someone on their first Killer match, this isn’t in the same zip code as fair.  Which wouldn’t be so soul crushing if they didn’t put it on Twitch and Youtube mocking, laughing at, and in general ridiculing a new player to the delight of a room full of viewers cheering on this bullying.  This community greets new players not with hospitality and acceptance, but with distain and indignation. This is evident in the wait times for matches.  You’ll wait between 5 and 10 minutes to find a match as a survivor.  But the Killer queue is ~1 minute.  So, the game needs new Killers, but the survivors are intent on scaring them all off.  
I don’t know, or care about, the NFTs.  If the publishers did something shady, it doesn’t change how fun the game is to play.  But the endless DLC needs to be noted:  $20 USD for the base game, $30 per “expansion pack” with nameless characters, and $5 or more per named characters (EG Michael Myers, Freddy Kruger, Ash Williams, etc.).  The base game only includes ~8 survivors and ~5 killers.   You’ll have to spend $250 for the entire game play experience.  This isn’t a deal breaker, but is a serious mark against.  
The biggest surprise was when a few friends invited me to play Killer against them in a private game.  These 4 have been playing since the game released.  I fully expected to get stomped out.  So imagine my surprise when the games were the most fun I’ve had since installing the game.  I could hear their communications about my whereabouts, but I could also hear their screams of terror when I dropped someone.  Teabags were replaced with helpful tips on chasing down a survivor.  Missed attacks were now followed with friendly banter and encouraging comments.  When I had a question about how someone did something, these four were there explaining the perks they use. When I had a question on one of the MANY poorly explained symbols in the game, they were there to address my query. And when I snuck up on my friend of 15 years, yelled into the mic “Oh it’s me, Charles!” and downed him for his final hook, my ears were awash with laughter and (most importantly) a voice saying “Great job man, I did not see that coming.”  Just typing this story out has made me smile. This shows that the game IS fun; the game IS good.  THIS is how the game is meant to be played.  If you have 4 or more friends that want this game, buy it; I cannot recommend this game enough for the private matches.  But that is the only scenario where I can endorse purchasing this game.  I plan to keep the game installed.  But until something is done to address the absolutely malignant community, I will be playing exclusively with friends.

It's an alright game for the first bit, but the gameplay gets super repetitive, and the community in the game is super toxic. I usually play survivor, so what can happen is teammates will purposefully reveal your location to the killer, and killers will camp a hooked survivor, making it near impossible to rescue them. This combined with the numerous bugs and glitches, devs making nfts, and devs not caring to patch the game or remove the toxic community, I honestly can't recommend this game at this point.

Alright lads, as much as I hate to say it the game is dead, or at least dying rapidly. I have tried to put up with this games BS for too long. The devs are incompetent, the Stranger Things DLC is getting removed, the games less balanced than a drunk guy on a tightrope, they sold NFTS, the community is toxic as shit, the list goes on. It really pains me to say it as a Horror fan but this game is only suitable for masochists or the terminally brain dead. Instead, go get Last Year, or VHS, or F13, or Monstrum Two, or any of the other significantly better asymmetrical horror games Dead by Daylight killed over the years.  Plus, at its best, dead by daylight is literally just run around object simulator. This shits not getting better any time soon. [b]Do. Not. Buy. This. Game. [/b]
